main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tlv

Class ObjectIdentifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tlv.ObjectIdentifier

  • public class ObjectIdentifier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class converts the object identifiers used in the TSE-simulator from String to byte[]. That means, converting it from the human readable form into the ASN.1 encoded form.
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private ObjectIdentifier()
      Class only provides static methods, therefore should not be instantiated.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • convertOIDtoTLVValue

        public static byte[] convertOIDtoTLVValue(java.lang.String OID)
        converts OIDs to value components according to ASN1. Can handle OIDs with values greater than 127 in them by calling advancedConvertOIDtoTLVValue(int[]) in the method body if necessary.
        Parameters:
        OID - an object identifier in the "dot" notation, e.g. 0.4.0.127.0.7.3.7.1.1
        Returns:
        a byte array representation of the OID specified by the String

      • advancedConvertOIDtoTLVValue

        public static byte[] advancedConvertOIDtoTLVValue(int[] splitIntOID)
        Converts OIDs to value components according to ASN1 standards. Shall be called when the OID to be converted contains a number greater than 127. Shall only be called by convertOIDtoTLVValue(String).
        Parameters:
        splitIntOID - an integer array filled with the content of the String array. Necessary to perform calculations on the numbers.
        Returns:
        a byte array representation of the OID specified by the String array

      • variableLengthEncoding

        public static byte[] variableLengthEncoding(int toBeEncoded)
        Used by #advancedConvertOIDtoTLVValue(String[], int[]), performs ASN.1 variable length encoding. Is used to encode the length of a value if the length would exceed the normally available single octet for length encoding.
        Parameters:
        toBeEncoded - the integer that shall be encoded
        Returns:
        a byte array encoding that integer base 128

      • convertTLVValueToOID

        public static java.lang.String convertTLVValueToOID(byte[] tlvOIDValue)
        The inverse method to convertOIDtoTLVValue(String). Takes a byte array that represents an ASN1 DER encoded OID and converts it to a String. Note: can only handle values that do not exceed the capacity of an integer
        Parameters:
        tlvOIDValue - the value byte array of an OID which has been encoded as an ASN1 DER TLV.
        Returns:
        a String in the "dot" notation that represents the OID. Example: 0.4.0.127.0.7.3.7.1.1
        See Also:
        TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[]), TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[])
